question.title: Two Non-Repeating Elements
question.content:
Given an array 'ARR' of integers of size N in which two elements appear exactly once and all other elements appear exactly twice. Your task is to find the two elements that appear only once.

Note
 1. Input will always have only two integers that appear exactly once rest will appear twice.
 2. Try to do this in linear time and constant space.
Input Format:
The first line of input contains an integer N representing the size of the array.

The second line of input contains an N space-separated integers representing the array elements.
Output Format:
Print the two space-separated elements that appear only once where the first integer is less than the second integer.
Constraints:
2 <= N <= 10^5
-10^5 <= ARR[i] <= 10^5

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1:
8
2 4 6 8 10 2 6 10
Sample Output 1:
4 8
Explanation of the Sample Input1:
4 and 8 appear only once in the array and rest all other elements appear twice in the array and 4 is printed first because it is smaller than the other element 8.
Sample Input 2:
4
-1 -1 5 3
Sample Output 2:
3 5
Explanation of the Sample Input2:
3 and 5 appear only once in the array and rest all other elements appear twice in the array and 3 is printed first because it is smaller than the other element 5.

rephrased.body: Given an array of integers where every element appears exactly twice except for two elements that appear exactly once, find those two unique elements. The goal is to achieve this in linear time and constant space complexity.
constraints: Input will always have only two integers that appear exactly once; the rest will appear twice.

testcases.explanation: The numbers 4 and 8 appear only once in the array, while the other numbers appear twice. 4 is printed first because it is smaller than 8.
The numbers 3 and 5 appear only once in the array, while -1 appears twice. 3 is printed first because it is smaller than 5.
The numbers 3 and 4 appear only once in the array, while the other numbers appear twice. 3 is printed first because it is smaller than 4.
The numbers 3 and 5 appear only once in the array, while 10 appears twice. 3 is printed first because it is smaller than 5.
The numbers 4 and 7 appear only once in the array, while the other numbers appear twice. 4 is printed first because it is smaller than 7.

hints: Try to do using the brute force method maybe using two for loop?
Try to think of a solution if we sort the array.
Can you think of a data structure to store the occurrences of each element?
